BLACK BEAN PROTEIN BROWNIES

You won't believe these fudgy, decadent brownies are made with black beans! 17g of protein per serving.

17g
Protein
160
Calories
40m
Total Time
12
Yield
Recipe Ingredients Instructions Troubleshooting Substitutions Nutrition Panel
DOWNLOAD PDF PACK
Free Resource

GET THE PRINTABLE PACK

Includes shopping list (grams), freezer guide, and the substitution matrix PDF.

DOWNLOAD PDF PACK

INGREDIENTS

  • 425g can of black beans, rinsed and drained
  • 3 large eggs
  • 90g chocolate whey protein powder
  • 45g unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 100g maple syrup
  • 60g melted coconut oil
  • 1 tsp vanilla extract
  • 1/2 tsp baking soda

STEP-BY-STEP INSTRUCTIONS

1

Preheat and Prep

Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C). Grease an 8x8 inch baking pan.

2

Blend Ingredients

In a blender or food processor, combine all ingredients. Blend until completely smooth.

3

Pour Batter

Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly.

4

Add Toppings

Optional: sprinkle some chocolate chips on top before baking.

5

Bake

Bake for 23-25 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.

6

Cool

Let the brownies cool completely in the pan before slicing.

TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE

Brownie is too dry

Try reducing baking time by 2-3 minutes, or add an extra tablespoon of Greek yogurt to the batter.

Not rising properly

Check that your baking powder is fresh (less than 6 months old). Also avoid overmixing the batter.

Gummy texture in center

This usually means under-baking. Use a toothpick to test - it should come out with just a few moist crumbs.

Too dense

Make sure you're measuring protein powder correctly. Too much protein powder can make baked goods dense.

SUBSTITUTION MATRIX

OriginalSwap WithMacro Impact
Whey ProteinCasein or Pea Protein+10% Liquid Required
Greek YogurtCottage Cheese (Blended)Higher Protein + Sodium

PRO TIPS

üí°

Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 5 days.

üí°

For best results, use a kitchen scale to measure ingredients in grams.

üí°

Let cool completely before storing to prevent sogginess.
